Enterprise Architecture.name: Target-State Enterprise Architecture
Enterprise Architecture.text:
Design a Salesforce-centric enterprise architecture for:
Industry: Retail
Region: ANZ
Workloads: Commerce, Order Management, ERP integration
SLA: 99.95%
Include: System landscape, core domains, integration strategy, identity access, resiliency (multi-region), data residency, governance model, and executive risks.

Enterprise Architecture.name: License + Cost Optimization Advisor
Enterprise Architecture.text:
Evaluate Salesforce license strategy:
- Map access by persona
- Platform vs CRM vs Community licenses
- API usage & governor risks
Output: Low/Medium/Stretch savings scenarios with red/yellow/green viability score.

Enterprise Architecture.name: Capability Heatmap & Roadmap
Enterprise Architecture.text: Turn current-state capability maturity into business roadmap phases (Quarterly), aligned with product architecture decisions and staffing needs. Include dependencies + RACI + KPIs.

Solutions Architecture.name: Salesforce Architecture Blueprint
Solutions Architecture.text: Create target-state architecture for: Retail + ANZ + Commerce + OMS + SAP. Include data flow, identity/auth, system boundaries, licensing, decisions, risks, and developer handoff backlog.

Solutions Architecture.name: Integration Pattern Comparison
Solutions Architecture.text: Compare MuleSoft, REST, Platform Events, CDC, External Services, and GraphQL for SAP→OMS→Commerce Inventory. Recommend with pros/cons, fault strategy, and governance.

Solutions Architecture.name: OMS + Commerce Solution Design (High Level)
Solutions Architecture.text: Design order lifecycle: remorse period, split shipments, ATP, payment capture/refund, error queues, exposure in SFCC and Service Cloud Workspaces.

Solutions Architecture.name: Deep-Dive OMS Failure Flows
Solutions Architecture.text: Focus: Declines, WISMO, 3PL delays, lost/damaged, customs, SLA breaches. Provide diagrams + retry logic + monitoring KPIs.

Solutions Architecture.name: Commerce Personalization Strategy
Solutions Architecture.text: Einstein personalization + CDP segments: In-stock only rules, geo-based promos, loyalty tiers, and stale-data fallbacks. Include caching + PDP performance model.

Technical Architecture.name: CI/CD + DevOps Strategy
Technical Architecture.text: Design GitHub Actions SFDX pipeline: Trunk with short branches, unlocked packages, automated tests, PMD, source tracking, rollback, and GitOps governance.

Technical Architecture.name: Data Migration Playbook
Technical Architecture.text: Source: SAP + Legacy SFCC; 2.4M orders. Include mapping templates, dependency resolution, reconciliation SQL, delta sync, and go/no-go checklist.

Technical Architecture.name: Inventory Sync Architecture
Technical Architecture.text: OMS→Commerce near-real-time inventory (<500ms UI freshness). Include safety stock, backorder logic, pre-order gating, GraphQL example payloads.

Technical Architecture.name: Export Tooling for Git Governance
Technical Architecture.text: Generate CLI: Extract Apex, Flows, PermSets, Custom Metadata, and External Credentials. Support `--diff`, tagging, and artifact packaging.

Tech Lead.name: Contributor Onboarding Kit
Tech Lead.text: Produce engineering onboarding: branching policy, sandbox workflow, code review guidelines, service boundaries, naming standards for LWCs, Flows, and sObjects.

Tech Lead.name: PR Template + Codeowners Strategy
Tech Lead.text: Create templates for approvals, test scope, rollout notes, and security rules. Add CODEOWNERS with domain ownership routing.

Tech Lead.name: Release Readiness Checklist
Tech Lead.text: Include: regression coverage, feature toggles, monitoring dashboards activated, DR plans updated, rollout/rollback runbooks, and stakeholder sign-offs.

Developer Enablement.text: Enforce semantic rules: feat/refactor/flow/lwc/config. Include hooks to validate metadata structure and enforce test naming conventions.

Developer Enablement.text: Given Apex + business rules, generate Test Data Factories and tests with Arrange/Act/Assert sections and negative scenarios for governor risk checks.
